content: You know, it would be really nice if we could have block descriptions or administrative titles, even for standard block. It would be very handy to know what's in a particular section of a layout for a page. HERO BLOCK or Custom Text, really doesn't tell me anything. Services, Testimonials, Contact, Team, etc. are a heck of a lot more useful, especially when they are all the same kind of block (example - HERO BLOCK). GAH...

I'm having the same issue right now. I had a layout last night with several "Custom Blocks" and I could not tell them apart in the layout UI.

I was planning to look for an issue in the issue queue on this topic and found: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/692

[UX] Make block and layout titles required and allow them to be hidden. · Issue #692 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This is basically the same as Make the block title required and allow it to be hidden for D8, but applied to both block titles and layout page titles. D7 (<none> required to hide title): D8 (...
@Elisabeth Garbeil - I just learned (and you might be able to use this), that if you make your custom block "reusable," you have the option to add an administrative title and description.

StPaulTim said:

Elisabeth Garbeil - I just learned (and you might be able to use this), that if you make your custom block "reusable," you have the option to add an administrative title and description.

Yep, I have this same problem on every site I've converted so far. It's annoying, and I don't want to make every block reusable, nor do I want every block custom. Why can't we have an administrative title/description on every block? I only have approximately 40 or more sites to either convert to backdrop or Wordpress. Why should I have to edit a block on a layout to figure out what I put there?

There's also https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2288

[UX] Replace the default description of custom blocks with an excerpt from the block content. · Issue #2288 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I realize that the issue title makes it sound like a feature request, but this is in fact a UX bug... If one adds more than one custom blocks in a layout and they leave their display title blank, t...

...meh :sweat: ...it's so old that the PR sandbox is broken. The branch has conflicts, so it isn't easy to just restart the sandbox.
...I'll get to it eventually.

klonos said:

...I'll get to it eventually.

Soon - pretty pretty please!!!!!!! (with sugar on top). I have a lot more sites to do next year and this is driving me crazy.

To clarify, by "get to it" I meant resolve the conflicts and re-launch the sandbox for testing. ...in order for that to get into core, we'd need to have consensus (which from the ticket history I see that we don't). ...otherwise, you'll need to be applying my PR as a patch to your sites :sweat:
...or perhaps someone can turn that into a contrib module? :wink:

@Elisabeth Garbeil - I don't want to pressure you, BUT...

Posting a comment on an existing issue like this in the issue queue, saying that you are experiencing the same problem someone else reported, is actually helpful and often leads to an issue getting more attention. I've done it a number of times and on occasion, my additional comment has motivated folks to complete the task and fix something that had been lingering for years.

Having said that, it doesn't always happen that way...

@docwilmot - And they only have admin titles if you make them reusable.
ok, probably need sleep. On Hero blocks isnt that the "Display title"
That's the title displayed on the frontend. We're wanting a 'label' that's only displayed in the admin/layouts UI.

e.g. you might want a hero block with just an image on your frontapge, so the 'Display title' has to be empty. But then there's no way of setting an admin label to be displayed in the layouts UI so you know which hero block that is (you might have several).
Ah this is for blocks where you dont want a title on the frontend
